result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheena M. Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Huber granted.  *May serve in Brown County.  *Report clean & sober.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
*Submit DNA & pay surcharges. *Court appointed attorney fees to be paid. *Payment Plan:  $50/month commecing in September.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

of Warrant Cancellation
Attorney billing
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Sheena M. Nelson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Peebles makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before September 19, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May serve in Brown County
Credit = 0 days
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in September
Sentencing hearing on July 21, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Sheena M. Nelson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BY THE COURT:  Based on Ms. Nelson's appearance, Court will quash the warrant that had previously been authorized.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to 961.41(3g)(e) - Class U Misd.  Defendant to enter a plea and sentencing will be scheduled.  Atty Peebles agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court approves the amendment to Ct 1.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea to amended count 1.   Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court questions Atty Peebles.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1.
Atty Peebles requests a July sentencing date as the defendant is due in June.  Atty Hendee will leave it up to the Court to schedule out that far.
BY THE COURT:  Set for July.  Bond to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney James D. Peebles in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Atty Peebles called him yesterday letting him know that his client would most likely not be here today.  Atty Peebles agrees and said that he had sent a reminder notice of the hearing today; he received a call from the defendant yesterday and she had thought that it was next week.  Defendant does not have a license to get here.  
Atty Peebles asks the court to not issue a warrant and reset the date.    Atty Hendee responds and requests the court issue a warrant.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will be issued but stayed until April 11th at 2:00pm.  
Set hearing for April 11th at 2:00pm.  If defendant fails to appear at the April 11th hearing, the warrant will be issued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-07-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Sheena M. Nelson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there has been discussions regarding settlement however, in speaking with Atty Peebles there is not an agreement at this time.  Atty Peebles agrees and states that his client would like to accept the offer however, the defendant is pregnant and needs some time.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-04-2016 11:15 am
D.A. DISCOVERY INVOICE
D.A. Discovery Invoice
State's
Return date at 12-17-2015 01:45 pm

Defendant Sheena M. Nelson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Peebles; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Peebles agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Peebles states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Peebles enters a Not Guilty plea.

  BY THE COURT:   Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.  
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
